name: Yin Yang 0002
content: Yin Yang's Homepage Yin Yang Associate Professor Kahlert School of Computing The University of Utah Office: MEB 3454 Email: yangzzzy@gmail.com | yin.yang@utah.edu I am an associate professor with Kahlert School of Computing, University of Utah. I co-direct Utah Graphics Lab with my colleague Cem Yuksel. I am also affiliated with Utah Robotic Center. Before joining the U, the birthplace of Computer Graphics, I was a faculty member at University of New Mexico and Clemson University. I received my Ph.D. from University of Texas at Dallas (with David Daniel fellowship). I am a recipient of the NSF CRII award (2015) and CAREER award (2019). My research aims to develop efficient and customized computing methods for challenging problems in Graphics, Simulation, Deep Learning, Vision, Robotics, and many other applied areas. My name reads like Yin & Yang in Mandarin if you put my first name first, which is a famous concept in traditional Chinese philosophy and also a key inspiration in my research and life.
